title: HTML Paragraphs
text:
The HTML

element defines a paragraph.
A paragraph always starts on a new line, and browsers automatically add some white space (a margin) before and after a paragraph.

Example

This is a paragraph.

This is another paragraph.

Try it Yourself »

examples.heading: Example
examples.code:
This is a paragraph.

This is another paragraph.

title: HTML Display
text: You cannot be sure how HTML will be displayed.
Large or small screens, and resized windows will create different results.
With HTML, you cannot change the display by adding extra spaces or extra lines in your HTML code.

The browser will automatically remove any extra spaces and lines when the page is 
displayed:

Example

This paragraphcontains a lot of linesin the source code,but the browser ignores it.

This paragraphcontains         a lot of spacesin the source         code,but the        browser ignores it.

Try it Yourself »

examples.heading: Example
examples.code:
This paragraphcontains a lot of linesin the source code,but the browser ignores it.

This paragraphcontains         a lot of spacesin the source         code,but the        browser ignores it.

title: HTML Horizontal Rules
text:
The <hr> tag defines a thematic break in an HTML page, and is most often 
displayed as a horizontal rule.

The <hr> element is used to separate content (or define a change) in an HTML 
page:

Example

This is heading 1

This is some text.

This is heading 2

This is some other text.

Try it Yourself »
The <hr> tag is an empty tag, which means that it has no end tag.

examples.heading: Example
examples.code:
This is heading 1

This is some text.

This is heading 2

This is some other text.

title: HTML Line Breaks
text:
The HTML
element defines a line break.

Use
if you want a line break (a new line) without starting a new paragraph:

Example

This is
a paragraph
with line breaks.

Try it Yourself »

The
tag is an empty tag, which means that it has no end tag.

title: The Poem Problem
text: This poem will display on a single line:

Example

  My Bonnie lies over the ocean.  My Bonnie lies over the sea.  My Bonnie lies over the ocean.  Oh, bring back my Bonnie to me.

Try it Yourself »

examples.heading: Example
examples.code: My Bonnie lies over the ocean.  My Bonnie lies over the sea.  My Bonnie lies over the ocean.  Oh, bring back my Bonnie to me.

title: Solution - The HTML <pre> Element
text: The HTML <pre> element defines preformatted text.

The text inside a <pre> element is displayed in a fixed-width font (usually 
Courier), and it preserves both spaces and line breaks:

Example 
  My Bonnie lies over the ocean.
  My Bonnie lies over the sea.  My Bonnie lies over the 
ocean.  Oh, bring back my Bonnie to me.
Try it Yourself »

examples.heading: Example
examples.code:
My Bonnie lies over the ocean.
  My Bonnie lies over the sea.  My Bonnie lies over the 
ocean.  Oh, bring back my Bonnie to me.

title: HTML Tag Reference
text: W3Schools' tag reference contains additional information about HTML elements and their attributes.
For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
